me.unei.digicode.api

Interface ICode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Iterable<Digits>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Code, ReadOnlyCode

    public interface ICode
extends Iterable<Digits>, Cloneable
    Represent a code made of Digits.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(Digits digit)
        Appends a digit to the end of this digit list (code).
        Parameters:
        digit - The digit to add to this code.
        Returns:
        Returns `true` if this code has been modified, `false` otherwise.

      • set

        boolean set(int pos,
            Digits digit)
        Sets a digit at a given location in the code.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position where the digit should be set.
        digit - The digit to set in this code.
        Returns:
        Returns `true` if this code has been modified, `false` otherwise.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset this code to an empty one.

      • get

        Digits get(int pos)
        Gets the digit at the request position in the code.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position where to get the digit from.
        Returns:
        Returns the digit at the given position or `null` if position is not in range.

      • toRaw

        Digits[] toRaw()
        Gets a full copy of the current code state.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the code as a digit array.

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Gets the current length of the code.
        Returns:
        Returns the length of the code.

      • isSame

        boolean isSame(ICode code)
        Checks whenever the two codes represent the same digit list.
        Parameters:
        code - The code to be compared with.
        Returns:
        Returns 'true' if the 2 codes are same, 'false' otherwise.

        ICode clone()
